<h3 id="text-modifiers" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#text-modifiers" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Text modifiers</h3>
<p>Canvas2Ds text rendering capabilities have been woefully behind.
Chrome has added several new attributes to Canvas2D text rendering:</p>
<ul>
<li>ctx.<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/letter-spacing">letterSpacing</a></li>
<li>ctx.<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/word-spacing">wordSpacing</a></li>
<li>ctx.<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/font-variant">fontVariant</a></li>
<li>ctx.<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/font-kerning">fontKerning</a></li>
<li>ctx.<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/font-stretch">fontStretch</a></li>
<li>ctx.<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/text-decoration">textDecoration</a></li>
<li>ctx.<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/text-underline-position">textUnderlinePosition</a></li>
<li>ctx.<a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/text-rendering">textRendering</a></li>
</ul>
<p>These attributes all match their CSS counterparts with the same names.</p>
<h2 id="part-2-ergonomic-tweaks" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#part-2-ergonomic-tweaks" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Part 2: ergonomic tweaks</h2>
<p>Previously, some things with Canvas2D were possible, but needlessly complicated to implement.
Here are some quality-of-life improvements for javascript developers who want to use Canvas2D:</p>
<h3 id="contextreset" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#contextreset" aria-hidden="true">#</a> context.reset()</h3>
<p>To explain clearing a canvas, I've written a silly little <a href="https://glitch.com/edit/#!/wax-rapid-antlion">function to draw a retro pattern</a>:</p>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token function">draw90sPattern</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></code></pre>
<img alt="A retro pattern of triangles and squares." decoding="async" height="500" loading="lazy" sizes="(min-width: 500px) 500px, calc(100vw - 48px)" src="https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format" srcset="https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=200 200w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=228 228w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=260 260w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=296 296w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=338 338w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=385 385w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=439 439w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=500 500w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=571 571w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=650 650w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=741 741w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=845 845w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=964 964w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/KRHLGxmk98zv8mSEWdPI.png?auto=format&w=1000 1000w" width="500">
<p>Great! Now that I'm done with that pattern, I want to clear the canvas and draw something else.
Wait, how do we clear a canvas again? Oh yeah! <code>ctx.clearRect()</code>, of course.</p>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">ctx<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">clearRect</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">0</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">0</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span>width<span class="token punctuation">,</span> canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span>height<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></code></pre>
<p>Huh… that didn't work. Oh yeah! I've got to reset the transform first:</p>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">ctx<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">resetTransform</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>ctx<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">clearRect</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">0</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">0</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span>width<span class="token punctuation">,</span> canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span>height<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></code></pre>
<img alt="A blank canvas." decoding="async" height="500" loading="lazy" sizes="(min-width: 500px) 500px, calc(100vw - 48px)" src="https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format" srcset="https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=200 200w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=228 228w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=260 260w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=296 296w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=338 338w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=385 385w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=439 439w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=500 500w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=571 571w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=650 650w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=741 741w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=845 845w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=964 964w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/ddoRhRRV8AuTy1Z82yEj.png?auto=format&w=1000 1000w" width="500">
<p>Perfect! A nice blank canvas. Now let's start drawing a nice horizontal line:</p>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">  ctx<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">moveTo</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token number">10</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">10</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>  ctx<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">lineTo</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span>width<span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">10</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>  ctx<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">stroke</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></code></pre>
<img alt="A horizontal and a diagonal line." decoding="async" height="500" loading="lazy" sizes="(min-width: 500px) 500px, calc(100vw - 48px)" src="https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format" srcset="https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=200 200w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=228 228w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=260 260w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=296 296w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=338 338w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=385 385w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=439 439w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=500 500w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=571 571w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=650 650w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=741 741w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=845 845w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=964 964w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/VlZkoPMTOuzD6bUeTd1i.png?auto=format&w=1000 1000w" width="500">
<p>Grrrr! That's not right! 😡 What's that extra line doing here? Also, why is it pink? Okay, let's just check StackOverflow.</p>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span>width <span class="token operator">=</span> canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span>width<span class="token punctuation">;</span></code></pre>
<p>Why is this so silly? Why is this so hard?</p>
<p>Well, it's not any more. With the new api we have the simple, elegant, beautiful groundbreaking:</p>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">ctx<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">reset</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></code></pre>
<p>Sorry that took so long.</p>
<h3 id="filters" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#filters" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Filters</h3>
<p>SVG filters are a world unto themselves. If they're new to you I highly recommend reading &quot;<a href="https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2015/05/why-the-svg-filter-is-awesome/">The Art Of SVG Filters And Why It Is Awesome</a>&quot;, which shows some of their amazing potential.</p>
<p>SVG style filters are already available for Canvas2D! You just have to be willing to pass the filter as a url pointing to another SVG filter element on the page:</p>
<pre class="language-html"><code class="language-html"><span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>svg</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><br>    <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>defs</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><br>     <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>filter</span> <span class="token attr-name">id</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>svgFilter<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><br>       <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>feGaussianBlur</span> <span class="token attr-name">in</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>SourceGraphic<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">stdDeviation</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>5<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">/></span></span><br>       <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>feConvolveMatrix</span> <span class="token attr-name">kernelMatrix</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>-3 0 0 0 0.5 0 0 0 3<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">/></span></span><br>       <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;</span>feColorMatrix</span> <span class="token attr-name">type</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>hueRotate<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span> <span class="token attr-name">values</span><span class="token attr-value"><span class="token punctuation attr-equals">=</span><span class="token punctuation">"</span>90<span class="token punctuation">"</span></span><span class="token punctuation">/></span></span><br>     <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>filter</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><br>    <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>defs</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span><br> <span class="token tag"><span class="token tag"><span class="token punctuation">&lt;/</span>svg</span><span class="token punctuation">></span></span></code></pre>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">  <span class="token keyword">const</span> canvas <span class="token operator">=</span> document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">createElement</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">"canvas"</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>  canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span>width <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">500</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>  canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span>height <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">400</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>  <span class="token keyword">const</span> ctx <span class="token operator">=</span> canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getContext</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">"2d"</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>  document<span class="token punctuation">.</span>body<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">appendChild</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>canvas<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br><br>  ctx<span class="token punctuation">.</span>filter <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token string">"url('#svgFilter')"</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>  <span class="token function">draw90sPattern</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span>ctx<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></code></pre>
<p>Which messes up our pattern pretty good:</p>
<img alt="The retro pattern with a blurred effect applied." decoding="async" height="500" loading="lazy" sizes="(min-width: 500px) 500px, calc(100vw - 48px)" src="https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format" srcset="https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=200 200w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=228 228w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=260 260w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=296 296w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=338 338w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=385 385w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=439 439w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=500 500w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=571 571w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=650 650w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=741 741w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=845 845w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=964 964w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/kheDArv5csY6rvQUJDbWRscckLr1/IPgddXUAwJFZzowzdxtx.png?auto=format&w=1000 1000w" width="500">
<p>But, what if you wanted to do the above but stay within JavaScript and not mess around with strings? With the new API, this is totally possible.</p>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js">  ctx<span class="token punctuation">.</span>filter <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token keyword">new</span> <span class="token class-name">CanvasFilter</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">[</span><br>    <span class="token punctuation">{</span>filter<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">"gaussianBlur"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> stdDeviation<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token number">5</span><span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span><br>    <span class="token punctuation">{</span>filter<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">"convolveMatrix"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span><br>      kernelMatrix<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token punctuation">[</span><br>        <span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token operator">-</span><span class="token number">3</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">0</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">0</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span><br>        <span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token number">0</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">0.5</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">0</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span><br>        <span class="token punctuation">[</span><span class="token number">0</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">0</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token number">3</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">]</span><br>    <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span><br>    <span class="token punctuation">{</span>filter<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">"colorMatrix"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> type<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">"hueRotate"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> values<span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token number">90</span><span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span><br>  <span class="token punctuation">]</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></code></pre>
<p>Easy as pie! Try it and play with the parameters <a href="https://glitch.com/edit/#!/pretty-dent-titanoceratops">in the demo here</a>.</p>
<h2 id="part-3-performance-improvements" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#part-3-performance-improvements" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Part 3: performance improvements</h2>
<p>With the New Canvas2D API, we also wanted to improve performance where possible. We added a couple features to give developers finer-grained control of their websites and allow for the slickest possible framerates:</p>
<h3 id="will-read-frequently" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#will-read-frequently" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Will Read Frequently</h3>
<p>Use <code>getImageData()</code> to read pixel data back from a canvas. It can be very slow. The new API gives you a way of explicitly marking a canvas for reading back (for generative effects, for example). This allows you to optimize things under the hood and keep canvas fast for a larger variety of use cases. This feature has been in Firefox for a while and we're finally making it part of the canvas spec.</p>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">const</span> canvas <span class="token operator">=</span> document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">createElement</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'canvas'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br><span class="token keyword">const</span> ctx <span class="token operator">=</span> canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getContext</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'2d'</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span><span class="token string">'willReadFrequently'</span><span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token boolean">true</span><span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></code></pre>
<h3 id="context-loss" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#context-loss" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Context loss</h3>
<p>Let's make sad tabs happy again! In the event that a client runs out of GPU memory or some other disaster befalls your canvas, you can now receive a callback and redraw as needed:</p>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="token keyword">const</span> canvas <span class="token operator">=</span> document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">createElement</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'canvas'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br><span class="token keyword">const</span> ctx <span class="token operator">=</span> canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">getContext</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">'2d'</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br><br>canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">addEventListener</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">"contextlost"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> onContextLost<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>canvas<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">addEventListener</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">"contextrestored"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> redraw<span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></code></pre>
<p>If you want to read more about canvas context and loss, the WHATWG has <a href="https://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Canvas_Context_Loss_and_Restoration">a good explanation</a> on their wiki.</p>
<h2 id="conclusion" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#conclusion" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Conclusion</h2>
<p>Whether you're new to Canvas2D, you've been using it for years, or you've been avoiding using it for years, I'm here to tell you to give canvas another look. It's the API-next-door that's been there all along.</p>
<p><em>Hero image by <a href="https://unsplash.com/@honeypoppet?utm_source=unsplash&amp;utm_medium=referral&amp;utm_content=creditCopyText">Sandie Clarke</a> on <a href="https://unsplash.com/s/photos/canvas?utm_source=unsplash&amp;utm_medium=referral&amp;utm_content=creditCopyText">Unsplash</a></em></p>
</content>
  </entry>
  
  
  <entry>
    <title>New in Chrome 99</title>
    <link href="https://developer.chrome.com/en/blog/new-in-chrome-99/" />
    <updated>2022-03-01T00:00:00+00:00</updated>
    <id>https://developer.chrome.com/en/blog/new-in-chrome-99/</id>
    
      
      
      <author>
        <name><name>Pete LePage</name></name>
      </author>
      
    
    <content type="html"><div class="youtube">
  <iframe class="youtube__embed" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/h3mzFraS8CA" title="youtube embed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen="" loading="lazy"></iframe>
</div>
<p>Here's what you need to know:</p>
<ul>
<li>The count down to <a href="#v100">version 100</a> of Chrome and Firefox is just
weeks away.</li>
<li><a href="#layers">CSS cascade layers</a> gives you more control over your CSS, and
helps to prevent style-specificity conflicts.</li>
<li>The <a href="#showPicker"><code>showPicker()</code></a> method allows you to programmatically
show a browser picker for <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> elements like <code>date</code>, <code>color</code>, and
<code>datalist</code>.</li>
<li>And there's plenty <a href="#more">more</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p>I'm <a href="https://petelepage.com/">Pete LePage</a>. Let's dive in and
see what's new for developers in Chrome 99.</p>
<h2 id="v100" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#v100" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Chrome 100 and Firefox 100</h2>
<p>Chrome 100 ships in late March (2022), and Firefox 100 ships shortly after in
early May. Both of these are a major version number milestone and roll over
to three digits. But, if your code is expecting two digits, the new version
number could cause issues for you.</p>
<p>Any code that checks version numbers, or parses the user agent string
should be checked to make sure it won't have any issues.</p>
<img alt="Chrome flags page highlighting the new #force-major-version-to-100 option" class="float-right" decoding="async" height="533" loading="lazy" sizes="(min-width: 800px) 800px, calc(100vw - 48px)" src="https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format" srcset="https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=200 200w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=228 228w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=260 260w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=296 296w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=338 338w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=385 385w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=439 439w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=500 500w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=571 571w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=650 650w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=741 741w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=845 845w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=964 964w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=1098 1098w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=1252 1252w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=1428 1428w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/0g2WvpbGRGdVs0aAPc6ObG7gkud2/4drS8JxKXgtzSAxyM6WF.png?auto=format&w=1600 1600w" width="800">
<p>In Chrome, the <code>#force-major-version-to-100</code> flag will change the current
version number to 100.</p>
<p>And in Firefox Nightly's Settings menu, you can enable
the &quot;Firefox 100 User-Agent String&quot; option. It's a good idea to test your
site so that you can make sure everything works as expected.</p>
<p>Check out <a href="https://web.dev/chrome-firefox-100/">Chrome and Firefox soon to reach major version 100</a> for
complete details.</p>
<div style="clear:both;"></div>
<h2 id="layers" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#layers" aria-hidden="true">#</a> CSS Cascade Layers</h2>
<p>Support for CSS Cascade Layers and the CSS <code>@layer</code> rule is landing in
Chrome 99. They provide more explicit control of your CSS files to prevent
style-specificity conflicts. This is especially useful for large codebases,
design systems, and when  managing third party styles in applications.</p>
<p>They introduce a new layer to the CSS <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/Cascade">cascade</a>. With layered styles,
the precedence of a layer always beats the specificity of a selector.</p>
<img alt="Illustration from project demo of breaking out UI" decoding="async" height="1145" loading="lazy" sizes="(min-width: 800px) 800px, calc(100vw - 48px)" src="https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format" srcset="https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=200 200w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=228 228w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=260 260w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=296 296w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=338 338w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=385 385w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=439 439w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=500 500w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=571 571w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=650 650w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=741 741w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=845 845w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=964 964w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=1098 1098w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=1252 1252w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=1428 1428w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/HodOHWjMnbNw56hvNASHWSgZyAf2/93JCD1oEt33cJdBAdC5g.jpeg?auto=format&w=1600 1600w" width="800">
<p>If you're trying to style a link, inside a <code>.card</code>, within a <code>.post</code> you will
find that the more specific selector will be applied. By using the <code>@layer</code>
rule, you can be more explicit about the style specificity of each, and make
sure that the link style in your card, overrides the link style in your post.</p>
<pre class="language-css"><code class="language-css"><span class="token atrule"><span class="token rule">@layer</span> base</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span><br>  <span class="token selector">a</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span><br>    <span class="token property">font-weight</span><span class="token punctuation">:</span> 800<span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>    <span class="token property">color</span><span class="token punctuation">:</span> red<span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>  <span class="token punctuation">}</span><br><br>  <span class="token selector">.link</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span><br>    <span class="token property">color</span><span class="token punctuation">:</span> blue<span class="token punctuation">;</span><br>  <span class="token punctuation">}</span><br><span class="token punctuation">}</span></code></pre>
<p>This is because of cascade precedence. Layered styles create new cascade
planes.</p>
<p>Cascade layers using the CSS <code>@layer</code> rule are supported in Chrome 99,
Firefox 97, and Safari 15.4 Beta. Check out
<a href="https://developer.chrome.com/blog/cascade-layers/">Cascade layers are coming to your browser</a> for
more information.</p>
<h2 id="showPicker" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#showPicker" aria-hidden="true">#</a> showPicker() for input elements</h2>
<p>For a long time, we've had to resort to custom widget libraries or hacks to
show a date picker. There's a new <code>showPicker()</code> method on HTML <code>InputElements</code>.
It's the canonical way to show a browser picker, not only for <code>date</code>, but also
<code>time</code>, <code>color</code>, and other <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> elements with pickers.</p>
<figure class="w-figure">
<img alt="Screenshots of browser pickers" decoding="async" height="217" loading="lazy" sizes="(min-width: 800px) 800px, calc(100vw - 48px)" src="https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format" srcset="https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=200 200w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=228 228w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=260 260w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=296 296w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=338 338w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=385 385w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=439 439w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=500 500w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=571 571w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=650 650w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=741 741w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=845 845w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=964 964w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=1098 1098w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=1252 1252w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=1428 1428w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vvhSqZboQoZZN9wBvoXq72wzGAf1/uh0U2YQnUMato21MzzbR.png?auto=format&w=1600 1600w" width="800">
  <figcaption class="w-figcaption">Browser date pickers in Chrome desktop, Chrome mobile, Safari desktop, Safari mobile, and Firefox desktop (July 2021).</figcaption>
</figure>
<p>To use it, call <code>showPicker()</code> on the <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element. In this example, I
wrapped it in a <code>try…catch</code> block. That allows me to provide a fallback,
if the browser doesn't support the API, or can't show the picker. Thus,
ensuring that users still get a good experience.</p>
<pre class="language-js"><code class="language-js"><span class="highlight-line"><span class="token keyword">const</span> button <span class="token operator">=</span> document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">querySelector</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">"button"</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></span><br><span class="highlight-line"><span class="token keyword">const</span> dateInput <span class="token operator">=</span> document<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">querySelector</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">"input"</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></span><br><span class="highlight-line"></span><br><span class="highlight-line">button<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">addEventListener</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token string">"click"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token operator">=></span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span></span><br><span class="highlight-line">  <span class="token keyword">try</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span></span><br><mark class="highlight-line highlight-line-active">    dateInput<span class="token punctuation">.</span><span class="token function">showPicker</span><span class="token punctuation">(</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></mark><br><span class="highlight-line">    <span class="token comment">// A date picker is shown.</span></span><br><span class="highlight-line">  <span class="token punctuation">}</span> <span class="token keyword">catch</span> <span class="token punctuation">(</span>error<span class="token punctuation">)</span> <span class="token punctuation">{</span></span><br><span class="highlight-line">    <span class="token comment">// Use an external library when this fails.</span></span><br><span class="highlight-line">  <span class="token punctuation">}</span></span><br><span class="highlight-line"><span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">)</span><span class="token punctuation">;</span></span></code></pre>
<p>Check out <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/blog/show-picker/">Show a browser picker for date, time, color, and files</a>
for complete details, and all the different <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> types you can use
<code>showPicker()</code> for.</p>
<h2 id="more" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#more" aria-hidden="true">#</a> And more!</h2>
<p>Of course there's plenty more.</p>
<p>The Canvas2D API has been <a href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/6051647656558592">updated</a>, adding new functionality, including:</p>
<ul>
<li>Two new events for <code>ContextLost</code> and <code>ContextRestored</code></li>
<li>A <code>willReadFrequently</code> option</li>
<li>More CSS text modifier support</li>
<li>And more.</li>
</ul>
<p>There's a new origin trial to allow PWAs to provide alternate colors in the
<a href="https://developer.chrome.com/origintrials/#/view_trial/4239013149262479361">web app manifest for dark mode</a>.</p>
<p>And the <a href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5263213807534080">handwriting recognition API</a> has now landed.</p>
<h2 id="further-reading" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#further-reading" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Further reading</h2>
<p>This covers only some of the key highlights. Check the links below for
additional changes in Chrome 99.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://developer.chrome.com/blog/new-in-devtools-99/">What's new in Chrome DevTools (99)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://developer.chrome.com/blog/deps-rems-99/">Chrome 99 deprecations and removals</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.chromestatus.com/features#milestone%3D99">ChromeStatus.com updates for Chrome 99</a></li>
<li><a href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/98.0.4758.88..99.0.4844.48">Chromium source repository change list</a></li>
<li><a href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/schedule">Chrome release calendar</a></li>
</ul>
<h2 id="subscribe" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#subscribe" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Subscribe</h2>
<p>To stay up to date, <a href="https://goo.gl/6FP1a5">subscribe</a>
to <a href="https://www.youtube.com/user/ChromeDevelopers/">Chrome Developers YouTube channel</a>,
and you'll get an email notification whenever we launch a new video.</p>
<p>I'm Pete LePage, and as soon as Chrome 100 is released, I'll be right here to
tell you what's new in Chrome!</p>
</content>
  </entry>
  
  
  <entry>
    <title>User-Agent Reduction deprecation trial</title>
    <link href="https://developer.chrome.com/en/blog/user-agent-reduction-deprecation-trial/" />
    <updated>2022-02-24T00:00:00+00:00</updated>
    <id>https://developer.chrome.com/en/blog/user-agent-reduction-deprecation-trial/</id>
    
      
      
      <author>
        <name><name>Ali Beyad</name></name>
      </author>
      
      
      <author>
        <name><name>Victor Tan</name></name>
      </author>
      
    
    <content type="html"><p>Starting from Chrome 101, the information available in the User-Agent (UA) string will be reduced <a href="https://blog.chromium.org/2021/09/user-agent-reduction-origin-trial-and-dates.html">using a phased approach</a>. Sites that haven't had time to migrate away from using the reduced User-Agent string and <a href="https://web.dev/migrate-to-ua-ch/">move toward User-Agent Client Hints</a> can take part in a deprecation trial to continue receiving the full User-Agent string.</p>
<p>The registration for the deprecation trial will begin with the <a href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/schedule">Chrome 100</a> Beta. It will allow sites to receive the full User-Agent string ahead of the Chrome 101 release, where the minor version string will be reduced. If you would like to test the origin trial on Chrome 100 Beta before it launches to the stable channel, be sure to register and test before the release date for Chrome 100 (<a href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/schedule">currently scheduled for March 31st, 2022</a>).</p>
<p>Below is an overview of the deprecation trial and what to expect. If you have feedback to share or you encounter any issues throughout this trial let us know in the <a href="https://github.com/abeyad/user-agent-reduction/issues">UA Reduction Github repository</a>.</p>
<h2 id="what-does-this-mean-for-web-developers" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#what-does-this-mean-for-web-developers" aria-hidden="true">#</a> What does this mean for web developers?</h2>
<p>By enrolling in the deprecation trial, sites will continue to receive the full UA string in <code>navigator.userAgent</code> and non-reduced values in the related <code>navigator.platform</code> and <code>navigator.appVersion</code> JavaScript getters:</p>
<ul>
<li>The <code>User-Agent</code> HTTP request header</li>
<li>The <code>navigator.userAgent</code> Javascript getter</li>
<li>The <code>navigator.platform</code> Javascript getter</li>
<li>The <code>navigator.appVersion</code> Javascript getter</li>
</ul>
<p>Sites should still audit their usage of the User-Agent header and related APIs, and if needed prepare to <a href="https://web.dev/migrate-to-ua-ch/">migrate to User-Agent Client Hints</a> before the deprecation trial expires. The intent is to expire this deprecation trial once the <a href="https://blog.chromium.org/2021/09/user-agent-reduction-origin-trial-and-dates.html">User-Agent Reduction rollout</a> is complete.</p>
<h2 id="how-do-i-participate-in-the-user-agent-reduction-deprecation-trial" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#how-do-i-participate-in-the-user-agent-reduction-deprecation-trial" aria-hidden="true">#</a> How do I participate in the User-Agent Reduction deprecation  trial?</h2>
<h3 id="register-for-the-trial" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#register-for-the-trial" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Register for the trial</h3>
<p>To register for the origin trial and get a token for your domains, visit the <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/origintrials/#/view_trial/2608710084154359809">User Agent Reduction deprecation trial page</a>.</p>
<h3 id="setup" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#setup" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Setup</h3>
<p>Once you've registerd for the trial, update your HTTP response headers with the following:</p>
<ol>
<li>Add <code>Origin-Trial: &lt;ORIGIN TRIAL TOKEN&gt;</code> to your HTTP response header. &lt;<code>ORIGIN TRIAL TOKEN</code>&gt; contains the token you got when registering for the origin trial.</li>
<li>Add <code>Accept-CH: Sec-CH-UA-Full</code> to your HTTP response header. Setting <code>Accept-CH</code> will only cause the full User-Agent string to be sent on subsequent requests to the origin.</li>
<li>To resend the first navigation request with the full User-Agent string, add <code>Critical-CH: Sec-CH-UA-Full</code> to your HTTP response header, in addition to the <code>Accept-CH</code> and <code>Origin-Trial</code> headers.</li>
<li>If you want third-party subresource requests to also receive the full UA string, you have two options:
<ul>
<li>Add a <code>Permissions-Policy</code> header with the third-party domains that should receive the full UA.
<ul>
<li>To allow a named list of third-party domains, add <code>Permissions-Policy: ch-ua-full=(self &quot;https://google.com&quot;)</code>.</li>
<li>To allow all third-party domains, add <code>Permissions-Policy: ch-ua-full=*</code>.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Add an <code>Accept-CH</code> meta tag with the third-party domains that should receive the full UA (only in Chrome 100 and above).
<ul>
<li>To allow a named list of third-party domains, add <code>&lt;meta name=&quot;accept-ch&quot; content=&quot;ch-ua-full=( https://google.com )&quot;&gt;</code>.</li>
<li>It's not possible to delegate to all third-party domains via <code>*</code> in the meta tag.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Load your website in Chrome 100 (or later) and continue receiving the full User-Agent string.</li>
</ol>
<h3 id="demo" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#demo" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Demo</h3>
<p>See <a href="https://uard-ot-demo.glitch.me/">https://uard-ot-demo.glitch.me</a> for a demonstration of the trial (along with the source code).</p>
<h2 id="how-do-i-validate-that-the-trial-is-working" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#how-do-i-validate-that-the-trial-is-working" aria-hidden="true">#</a> How do I validate that the trial is working?</h2>
<p>To validate that the origin trial is working, examine the request headers and ensure the following:</p>
<ol>
<li>The User-Agent header contains the full version. It shouldn't contain any of the reduced values (found in the <a href="https://www.chromium.org/updates/ua-reduction#TOC-Sample-UA-Strings:-Phase-4">list of samples of reduced User-Agent strings</a>). An easy way to tell is that the Chrome minor version string should <strong>not</strong> be <code>0.0.0</code>.</li>
<li>The <code>Sec-CH-UA-Full</code> header is set to <code>?1</code>.</li>
</ol>
<p>The initial response's headers containing the origin-trial token should look like:</p>

https://wd.imgix.net/image/vgdbNJBYHma2o62ZqYmcnkq3j0o1/Hzi5O1mZQyZEKeokCQSe.png?auto=format&w=964 964w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vgdbNJBYHma2o62ZqYmcnkq3j0o1/Hzi5O1mZQyZEKeokCQSe.png?auto=format&w=1098 1098w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vgdbNJBYHma2o62ZqYmcnkq3j0o1/Hzi5O1mZQyZEKeokCQSe.png?auto=format&w=1252 1252w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vgdbNJBYHma2o62ZqYmcnkq3j0o1/Hzi5O1mZQyZEKeokCQSe.png?auto=format&w=1428 1428w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/vgdbNJBYHma2o62ZqYmcnkq3j0o1/Hzi5O1mZQyZEKeokCQSe.png?auto=format&w=1600 1600w" width="800">
<h2 id="how-do-i-stop-participating-in-the-user-agent-reduction-deprecation-trial" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#how-do-i-stop-participating-in-the-user-agent-reduction-deprecation-trial" aria-hidden="true">#</a> How do I stop participating in the User-Agent Reduction deprecation trial?</h2>
<p>At any given point in time during the trial, you can stop participating and receive the reduced User-Agent string. To stop participating:</p>
<ol>
<li>Send an <code>Accept-CH</code> header in your HTTP response that does <strong>not</strong> include <code>Sec-CH-UA-Full</code>. Note that <code>Accept-CH</code> with an empty value is a valid way to accomplish this if your site does not request any other Client Hints.</li>
<li>Remove the <code>Origin-Trial</code> header for the User-Agent Reduction deprecation trial from your HTTP response.</li>
<li>If set, remove <code>Sec-CH-UA-Full</code> from the <code>Critical-CH</code> header in your HTTP response.</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="how-is-this-trial-different-from-other-user-agent-origin-trials" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#how-is-this-trial-different-from-other-user-agent-origin-trials" aria-hidden="true">#</a> How is this trial different from other User-Agent origin trials?</h2>
<p>Chrome is running two origin trials related to User Agent reduction. The first was <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/origintrials/#/view_trial/-7123568710593282047">User Agent Reduction origin trial</a>, which allowed sites to receive the reduced user agent string to test their use cases and provide feedback before it becomes the default behavior in Chrome.</p>
<p>The second, referenced here, is a deprecation trial intended for sites that need a little more time to migrate to the <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/User-Agent_Client_Hints_API">User-Agent Client Hints API</a>. It enables sites to continue receiving the full User-Agent string.</p>
<h2 id="how-long-will-the-deprecation-trial-last" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#how-long-will-the-deprecation-trial-last" aria-hidden="true">#</a> How long will the deprecation trial last?</h2>
<p>The UA Reduction deprecation trial will run from Chrome 100 to Chrome 112. Chrome 113 will be the first release where only the completely reduced User-Agent string is sent.</p>
<h2 id="how-do-i-share-feedback-for-the-user-agent-reduction-depreciation-trial" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#how-do-i-share-feedback-for-the-user-agent-reduction-depreciation-trial" aria-hidden="true">#</a> How do I share feedback for the User-Agent Reduction depreciation trial?</h2>
<p>Submit any issues or feedback to the <a href="https://github.com/abeyad/user-agent-reduction/issues">User-Agent Reduction Github repository</a>.</p>
</content>
  </entry>
  
  
  <entry>
    <title>What's New In DevTools (Chrome 99)</title>
    <link href="https://developer.chrome.com/en/blog/new-in-devtools-99/" />
    <updated>2022-02-21T00:00:00+00:00</updated>
    <id>https://developer.chrome.com/en/blog/new-in-devtools-99/</id>
    
      
      
      <author>
        <name><name>Jecelyn Yeen</name></name>
      </author>
      
    
    <content type="html"><div class="aside aside--note">
<p>Interested in helping improve DevTools? Sign up to participate in <a href="https://google.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_9YbKj35IGoGsDBj?reserved=1&amp;utm_source=Website%20feature&amp;Q_Language=en&amp;utm_medium=own_web&amp;utm_campaign=Q4&amp;productTag=chrm&amp;campaignDate=November2020&amp;referral_code=UXFm430458">Google User Research here</a>.</p>
</div>
<div class="youtube">
  <iframe class="youtube__embed" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zFVWeOKZBHs" title="youtube embed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen="" loading="lazy"></iframe>
</div>
<h2 id="websocket" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#websocket" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Throttling WebSocket requests</h2>
<p>The <strong>Network</strong> panel now supports throttling web socket requests. Previously, the network throttling didn't work on web socket requests.</p>
<p>Open the <strong>Network</strong> panel, click on a web socket request and open the <strong>Messages</strong> tab to observe the message transfers. Select <strong>Slow 3G</strong> to throttle the speed.</p>

<p>Chromium issue: <a href="https://crbug.com/423246">423246</a></p>
<h2 id="reporting-api" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#reporting-api" aria-hidden="true">#</a> New Reporting API pane in the Application panel</h2>
<p>Use the new <strong>Reporting API</strong> pane to monitor the reports generated on your page and their status.</p>
<p>The <a href="https://web.dev/reporting-api/">Reporting API</a> is designed to help you monitor security violations of your page, deprecated API calls, and more.</p>
<p>Open a page which uses the Reporting API (e.g. <a href="https://reporting-api-demo.glitch.me/">demo page</a>). In the <strong>Application</strong> panel, scroll down to the <strong>Background services</strong> section and select the <strong>Reporting API</strong> pane.</p>
<p>The <strong>Reports</strong> section shows you a list of reports generated on your page and their status. Click on it to view the report’s details.</p>
<p>The <strong>Endpoints</strong> section gives you an overview of all the endpoints configured in the <code>Reporting-Endpoints</code> header.</p>

https://wd.imgix.net/image/dPDCek3EhZgLQPGtEG3y0fTn4v82/D1fUz4zuS1xwDbszgft1.png?auto=format&w=1428 1428w, <p>Chromium issue: <a href="https://crbug.com/1205856">1205856</a></p>
<h2 id="recorder" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#recorder" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Support wait until element is visible/clickable in the Recorder panel</h2>
<p>When replaying a user flow recording, the <strong>Recorder</strong> panel will now wait until the element is visible or clickable in the viewport or try to automatically scroll the element into the viewport before replaying the step. Previously, the replay would fail immediately.</p>
<p>Here is an example of an off-screen menu positioned outside of the viewport and slide in when activated. The user flow is to toggle the menu, and click on the menu item. Previously, the replay would fail at the last step, because the menu item is still sliding in and not visible in the viewport yet. It’s fixed now.</p>
<p><video autoplay="" class="screenshot" controls="" loop="" muted="">      <source src="https://storage.googleapis.com/web-dev-uploads/video/dPDCek3EhZgLQPGtEG3y0fTn4v82/Qf8f2x1u1y5FEMSmkB3A.mp4" type="video/mp4">    </video></p>
<p>Chromium issue: <a href="https://crbug.com/1257499#c38">1257499</a></p>
<h2 id="console" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#console" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Better console styling, formatting and filtering</h2>
<h3 id="console-styling" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#console-styling" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Properly style log messages with ANSI escape code</h3>
<p>You can now use the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANSI_escape_code">ANSI escape sequences</a> to properly style console messages. Previously, DevTools console had very limited (and partly broken) support for ANSI escape sequences.</p>
<p>It is common for <a href="https://nodejs.org/">Node.js</a> developers to colorize log messages via ANSI escape sequences, often with the help of some styling libraries like <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/chalk">chalk</a>, <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/colors">colors</a>, <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/ansi-colors">ansi-colors</a>, <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/kleur">kleur</a>, etc.</p>
<p>With these changes, you can now debug your Node.js applications seamlessly using DevTools, with proper colorized console messages. Open this <a href="https://stackblitz.com/edit/node-colors-test">demo</a> to view it yourself!</p>
<p>To learn more about formatting &amp; styling console messages with DevTools, go to <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/console/format-style">format and style messages in the Console</a> documentation.</p>

<h3 id="console-format" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#console-format" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Properly support <code>%s</code>, <code>%d</code>, <code>%i</code> and <code>%f</code> format specifiers</h3>
<p>The <strong>Console</strong> now properly performs the <code>%s</code>, <code>%d</code>, <code>%i</code>, and <code>%f</code> type conversions as specified in the <a href="https://console.spec.whatwg.org/">Console Standard</a>. Previously, the conversation result was inconsistent.</p>

<h3 id="console-filter" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#console-filter" aria-hidden="true">#</a> More intuitive console group filter</h3>
<p>When filtering the console message, a console message is now shown if its message content matches the filter or the title of the group (or the ancestor group) matches the filter. Previously, the console group title would show despite the filter.</p>
<p>In addition, if a console message is shown, the group (or the ancestor group) it belongs to is now shown as well.</p>

<h2 id="sourcemap" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#sourcemap" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Sourcemaps improvements</h2>
<h3 id="extension" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#extension" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Debug Chrome extension with sourcemap files</h3>
<p>You can now <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/getstarted/#unpacked">debug Chrome extension</a> with sourcemap files. Previously, DevTools only supported inline sourcemap for Chrome extension debugging.</p>

<h3 id="source-tree" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#source-tree" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Improved source folder tree in the Sources panel</h3>
<p>The source folder tree in the <strong>Sources</strong> panel is now improved with less clutter in the folder structures and naming (e.g. “../”, “./”, etc). Under the hood, this is the result of normalizing the absolute source URLs in the sourcemaps.</p>

<h1 id="auto-dark-mode">Chrome’s Auto Dark Theme updates</h1>
<p>The <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/blog/new-in-devtools-96/#auto-dark-mode">Auto Dark Theme emulation</a> UI is now simplified. It is a checkbox now, it was a dropdown previously.</p>
<p>Apart from that, when the <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/blog/auto-dark-theme/">Auto Dark Theme</a> is enabled, the <strong>Emulate prefers-color-scheme</strong> dropdown will be disabled and set to <strong>prefers-color-scheme: dark</strong> automatically.</p>
<p>Chrome 96 introduces an <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/blog/origin-trials/">Origin Trial</a> for <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/blog/auto-dark-theme/">Auto Dark Theme</a> on Android. With this feature, the browser applies an automatically generated dark theme to light themed sites, when the user has opted into dark themes in the Operating System.</p>

<h2 id="touch-friendly" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#touch-friendly" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Touch-friendly color-picker and split pane</h2>
<p>You can now select color, and resize the <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/customize/#drawer">Drawer</a> in DevTools with fingers or stylus on touchscreen devices.</p>
<p>Here is an example captured with the <a href="https://www.google.com/chromebook/device/google-pixelbook/">Google Pixelbook</a> device touchscreen.</p>
<p><video autoplay="" class="screenshot" controls="" loop="" muted="">      <source src="https://storage.googleapis.com/web-dev-uploads/video/dPDCek3EhZgLQPGtEG3y0fTn4v82/aA3Oann2z26Yty9sgNB2.mp4" type="video/mp4">    </video></p>
<p>Chromium issues: <a href="https://crbug.com/1284245">1284245</a>, <a href="https://crbug.com/1284995">1284995</a></p>
<h2 id="misc" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#misc" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Miscellaneous highlights</h2>
<p>These are some noteworthy fixes in this release:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed the <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/storage/cookies/#edit">edit cookies</a> issue in the <strong>Cookies</strong> pane. (<a href="https://crbug.com/1290196">1290196</a>)</li>
<li>Use <code>Shift</code> + <code>Tab</code> to select the previous command in the <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/command-menu/">Command menu</a>. (<a href="https://crbug.com/1278743">1278743</a>)</li>
<li>Report <a href="https://web.dev/cross-origin-resource-sharing/#preflight-requests-for-complex-http-calls">CORS preflight request</a> issues in the <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/issues/">Issues</a> tab. (<a href="https://crbug.com/1272445">1272445</a>).</li>
<li>Report <a href="https://web.dev/user-agent-client-hints/">User-Agent Client Hints</a> issues in the <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/issues/">Issues</a> tab. (<a href="https://crbug.com/1219359">1219359</a>).</li>
<li>Fixed <code>Shift</code> + <code>Delete</code> and <code>Page up</code> / <code>Page down</code> behaviors in the <strong>Sources</strong> and <strong>Console</strong> panel. (<a href="https://crbug.com/1278461">1278461</a>, <a href="https://crbug.com/1285662">1285662</a>)</li>
<li>Close the breakpoint edit dialog on breakpoint removal in the <strong>Sources</strong> panel. (922513)</li>
<li>No reload required when <a href="https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/customize/dark-theme/">switching light/dark theme</a> in DevTools. (<a href="https://crbug.com/1278738">1278738</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="preview-channels" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#preview-channels" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Download the preview channels</h2>
<p>Consider using the Chrome <a href="https://www.google.com/chrome/canary/">Canary</a>, <a href="https://www.google.com/chrome/dev/">Dev</a> or <a href="https://www.google.com/chrome/beta/">Beta</a> as your default development browser. These preview channels give you access to the latest DevTools features, test cutting-edge web platform APIs, and find issues on your site before your users do!</p>
<h2 id="contact-us" tabindex="-1"><a class="heading-link" href="#contact-us" aria-hidden="true">#</a> Getting in touch with the Chrome DevTools team</h2>
<p>Use the following options to discuss the new features and changes in the post, or anything else related to DevTools.</p>
<ul>
<li>Submit a suggestion or feedback to us via <a href="https://crbug.com/">crbug.com</a>.</li>
<li>Report a DevTools issue using the <strong>More options</strong>   <img alt="More" decoding="async" height="20" loading="lazy" sizes="(min-width: 4px) 4px, calc(100vw - 48px)" src="https://wd.imgix.net/image/admin/4sdCQbpBaG4MpoHB1J08.png?auto=format" srcset="https://wd.imgix.net/image/admin/4sdCQbpBaG4MpoHB1J08.png?auto=format&w=4 4w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/admin/4sdCQbpBaG4MpoHB1J08.png?auto=format&w=5 5w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/admin/4sdCQbpBaG4MpoHB1J08.png?auto=format&w=5 5w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/admin/4sdCQbpBaG4MpoHB1J08.png?auto=format&w=6 6w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/admin/4sdCQbpBaG4MpoHB1J08.png?auto=format&w=7 7w, https://wd.imgix.net/image/admin/4sdCQbpBaG4MpoHB1J08.png?auto=format&w=8 8w" width="4">   &gt; <strong>Help</strong> &gt; <strong>Report a DevTools issues</strong> in DevTools.</li>
<li>Tweet at <a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=@ChromeDevTools" target="_blank">@ChromeDevTools</a>.</li>
<li>Leave comments on our What's new in DevTools <a href="https://goo.gle/devtools-youtube">YouTube videos</a>.</li>
</ul>
